adrFormatAddress: 173 Broadway, New York, NY 10007, USA

editorialSummary.text: Corner Asian restaurant serving sushi standards as well as noodle dishes & other Japanese favorites.

originalText.text:
Went here for the first time with my friend today. I had the Chicken Ramen. The payment kiosk had trouble accepting people's credit cards. Had to try three times before it went though. My friend was the lucky one. The staff tried about five times before he gave up.

So the ramen was not very good. It had an odd taste and the chicken looked old and dry. Took a few bites and ended up throwing most of the meal away. When someone is eating in, and eating soup, a tray should be given. Carrying the hot soup from the back to the front eating area felt precarious.

The staff did seem very kind and nice.

Something about the interior of this place is just depressing. There are much better places to get noodles in the area. The freshness of the food was very questionable.

originalText.text: I’m so disappointed. I used to use this shop before. Everything changed. The worst things was the hair inside. And the lady was so bad service. I was so sad and pissed.

text.text: I’m so disappointed. I used to use this shop before. Everything changed. The worst things was the hair inside. And the lady was so bad service. I was so sad and pissed.

originalText.text: This review is for the store on 32 Broadway. To me the best in town. I came there by coincidence because I was visiting the Charging Bull and was so hungry. I thought it was a tourist place because its such a busy area but its not at all. They have the best price/performance ratio I have seen in the city. The food is delicious, the staff are always super-friendly and the menu is very versatile. During my time in New York I went there almost every day. I highly recommend this place.

originalText.text: We stopped in this lovely place, it was freezing outside so it was nice to have a warm beef ramen which was absolutely delicious. The service was pretty quick considering it's very busy. The place is only a few seats but we've managed to get one and with the view as well watching the people passing by. The price was affordable and the portion was perfect for me, I am really full and ready to carry on with the day.

originalText.text: This 173 Broadway Is the best Sushi place I've ever been to amongst all the other locations. Manager and the employees are pretty friendly and helpful. I was wondering what to eat and the register guy understood by looking at my face so quickly came up with a great suggestion. Talking about the food it was splendid. So far my experience is OUTSTANDING. However, just one problem and that is they don't have Contactless payments like Apple/Google pay. I hope the management will come up with the payment solution soon. I wish the team best of luck , cheers
